title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mané K, Jombart T, Laddha (2023). readepi: Import Epidemiological Data R. R package version 0.0.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {readepi: Import Epidemiological Data into R},   author = {Karim Mané and Thibaut Jombart and Avinash Laddha},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.1}, }

title: Import Epidemiological Data into R
text: readepi provides functions importing epidemiological data R common health information systems.

title: Import Epidemiological Data into R
text: can install development version readepi GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") #devtools::install_github("epiverse-trace/readepi") suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(readepi))

what: Reading data from file or directory
title: Import Epidemiological Data into R
text: readepi() function can read read data various source including various file formats. based rio R package, hence can import data file format supported one. See details file formats allowed rio. Additionally, can read data space-separated file read specific files specified directory. reading data file directory, function expects following arguments:file.path: path file read. several files need imported directory, path directory,sep: separator columns file. required space-separated files,format: string used specify file format. useful file extension, file extension match actual type,: string used specify objects extracted (e.g. name excel sheet import),pattern: specified, files suffix imported specified directory. function return either data frame (import file) list data frames (several files imported directory).

title: Import Epidemiological Data into R
code: file = system.file("extdata", "test.json", package = "readepi") data = readepi(file.path = file)

what: importing data from excel file with 2 sheets
title: Import Epidemiological Data into R
text: importing second excel sheet
code: file = system.file("extdata", "test.xlsx", package = "readepi") data = readepi(file.path = file, which = "Sheet2")

what: importing data from several files in a directory
title: Import Epidemiological Data into R
code: # reading all files in the given directory dir.path = "inst/extdata" data = readepi(file.path = dir.path)  # reading only txt files data = readepi(file.path = dir.path, pattern = "txt")

what: Reading data from relational database management systems (RDBMS): HDSS, EMRS, REDCap
title: Import Epidemiological Data into R
text: Research data usually stored either relational databases NoSQL databases. MRCG, project data stored relational databases. HDSS EMRS host databases run MS SQL Server, REDCap (uses EAV schema) run MySQL server. import data HDSS EMRS (MS SQL Server) R, dependencies need installed first.

title: Import Epidemiological Data into R
text: using Unix-based system, need install MS ODBC driver compatible version target MS SQL server. SQL server 2019, version 15.0, installed ODBC Driver 17 SQL Server mac OS. compatible MRCG test server robin.mrc.gm. Details install driver can found . installed, list drivers can displayed R using: odbc::odbcListDrivers(). important view data stored MS SQL server. recommend install GUI Azure Data Studio.

what: importing data from RDBMS into R
title: Import Epidemiological Data into R
text: testing purpose, given access test server robin.mrc.gm. Users granted read access able pull data test server. read_epi() function can read data RDBMS. expects following arguments:credentials.file: path file user-specific credential details projects interest. tab-delimited file following columns: user_name: user name, password: user password (REDCap, corresponds token serves password project), host_name: host name (HDSS EMRS) URI (REDCap), project_id: project ID (REDCap) name database (HDSS EMRS) access , comment: summary description project database interest, dbms: name DBMS: ‘redcap’ ‘REDCap’ reading REDCap, ‘sqlserver’ ‘SQLServer’ reading MS SQL Server, port: port ID (used MS SQL Servers ).project.id relational DB, name database contains table data pulled. Otherwise, project ID given access . Note similar value project_id field credential file.driver.name name MS driver (HDSS EMRS). use odbc::odbcListDrivers() display list installed drivers,table.name: name target table (HDSS EMRS),records: vector comma-separated string subset subject IDs. specified, records correspond subjects imported,fields: vector comma-separated string column names. provided, columns imported,id.position: column position variable unique identifies subjects. specified column subject IDs first column. default 1. function returns list 2 data frames (data metadata) reading REDCap. data frame otherwise.

previous_headings: importing data from RDBMS into R
title: Import Epidemiological Data into R
text: given access **Pats__Covid_19_Cohort_1_Screening**.
code: # display the structure of the credentials file show_example_file() # credentials.file = system.file("extdata", "test.ini", package = "readepi")  # reading all fields and records the project data = readepi(credentials.file, project.id="Pats__Covid_19_Cohort_1_Screening") project.data = data$data project.metadeta = data$metadata  # reading specified fields and all records from the project fields = c("day_1_q_ran_id","redcap_event_name","day_1_q_1a","day_1_q_1b","day_1_q_1c","day_1_q_1","day_1_q_2","day_1_q_3","day_1_q_4","day_1_q_5") data = readepi(credentials.file, project.id="Pats__Covid_19_Cohort_1_Screening", fields = fields)  # reading specified records and all fields from the project records = c("C10001/3","C10002/1","C10003/7","C10004/5","C10005/9","C10006/8","C10007/6","C10008/4","C10009/2","C10010/1") data = readepi(credentials.file, project.id="Pats__Covid_19_Cohort_1_Screening", records =  records)  # reading specified records and fields from the project data = readepi(credentials.file, project.id="Pats__Covid_19_Cohort_1_Screening", records =  records, fields = fields)

previous_headings: importing data from RDBMS into R
title: Import Epidemiological Data into R
text: given access IBS_BHDSS database.
code: # reading all fields and all records from the `dss_events` table data = readepi(credentials.file, project.id="IBS_BHDSS", driver.name = "ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server", table.name = "dss_events")  # reading specified fields and all records from the table data = readepi(credentials.file, project.id="IBS_BHDSS", driver.name = "ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server", table.name = "dss_events", fields = fields)  # reading specified records and all fields from the table data = readepi(credentials.file, project.id="IBS_BHDSS", driver.name = "ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server", table.name = "dss_events", records = records)  # reading specified fields and records from the table data = readepi(credentials.file, project.id="IBS_BHDSS", driver.name = "ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server", table.name = "dss_events", records = records, fields = fields)

what: function to read data from relational databases hosted by online MS SQL server. The user needs to have read access to the database et should install the appropriate MS driver that is compatible with the SQLServer version — read_from_ms_sql_server
title: function to read data from relational databases hosted by online MS SQL server. The user needs to have read access to the database et should install the appropriate MS driver that is compatible with the SQLServer version — read_from_ms_sql_server
text: function read data relational databases hosted online MS SQL server. user needs read access database et install appropriate MS driver compatible SQLServer version

title: function to read data from relational databases hosted by online MS SQL server. The user needs to have read access to the database et should install the appropriate MS driver that is compatible with the SQLServer version — read_from_ms_sql_server
code: read_from_ms_sql_server(   user,   password,   host,   port,   database.name,   driver.name,   table.name,   records = NULL,   fields = NULL,   id.position = 1 )

title: function to read data from relational databases hosted by online MS SQL server. The user needs to have read access to the database et should install the appropriate MS driver that is compatible with the SQLServer version — read_from_ms_sql_server
text: user user name password user password host name host server port port ID database.name name database contains table data pulled driver.name name MS driver. use odbc::odbcListDrivers() display list installed drivers table.name name target table records vector comma-separated string subset subject IDs. specified, records correspond subjects imported. fields vector comma-separated string column names. provided, columns imported id.position column position variable unique identifies subjects. specified column subject IDs first column. default 1.

text: data frame

title: function to read data from REDCap — read_from_redcap
text: uri URI server token user-specific string serves password project project.id name project want import data id.position column position variable unique identifies subjects. specified column subject IDs first column. default 1. records vector comma-separated string subset subject IDs. specified, records correspond subjects imported. fields vector comma-separated string column names. provided, columns imported.

title: function to read data from REDCap — read_from_redcap
text: list 2 data frames: data interest metadata associated data.

title: function to read data from REDCap — read_from_redcap
code: redcap.data = read_from_redcap(uri="https://redcap.mrc.gm:8443/redcap/api/", token="9D71857D60F4016AB7BFFDA65970D737", project.id="Pats__Covid_19_Cohort_1_Screening", id.position=1, records=NULL, fields=NULL) #> Starting to read 280 records  at 2023-01-16 15:40:04. #>  #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> cols( #>   .default = col_double(), #>   day_1_q_ran_id = col_character(), #>   redcap_event_name = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_1a = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_1b = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_1c = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_1 = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_2 = col_datetime(format = ""), #>   day_1_q_4 = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_6c = col_character(), #>   day_1_oth_spc_vac = col_logical(), #>   day_1_q_9e = col_date(format = ""), #>   day_1_9hi = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_9f_2 = col_date(format = ""), #>   day_1_q_11 = col_time(format = ""), #>   day_1_q_14 = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_16 = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_16a = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_16d = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_17 = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_17a = col_character() #>   # ... with 509 more columns #> ) #> ℹ Use `spec()` for the full column specifications.

what: Function to import epidemiology-related data from different sources into R — readepi
title: Function to import epidemiology-related data from different sources into R — readepi
text: function allows import data stored database management systems (DBMS) including relational NoSQL databases. also contains functions import data common file types csv, txt, xlsx, xml, json, etc.

title: Function to import epidemiology-related data from different sources into R — readepi
code: readepi(   credentials.file = NULL,   file.path = NULL,   sep = NULL,   format = NULL,   which = NULL,   pattern = NULL,   project.id = NULL,   driver.name = NULL,   table.name = NULL,   records = NULL,   fields = NULL,   id.position = 1 )

title: Function to import epidemiology-related data from different sources into R — readepi
text: credentials.file path file user-specific credential details projects interest. required importing data DBMS. tab-delimited file following columns: user_name: user name password: user password (REDCap, corresponds token serves password project) host_name: host name (MS SQL servers) URI (REDCap) project_id: project ID name database access . comment: summary description project database interest dbms: name DBMS: 'redcap' 'REDCap' reading REDCap, 'sqlserver' 'SQLServer' reading MS SQLServer port: port ID (used MS SQLServers) file.path path file read. several files need imported directory, path directory sep separator columns file. required space-separated files. format string used specify file format. useful file extension, file extension match actual type string used specify objects extracted (name excel sheet import) pattern specified, files suffix imported specified directory project.id relational DB, name database contains table data pulled. Otherwise, project ID given access . driver.name name MS driver. use odbc::odbcListDrivers() display list installed drivers table.name name target table records vector comma-separated string subset subject IDs. specified, records correspond subjects imported. fields vector comma-separated string column names. provided, columns imported. id.position column position variable unique identifies subjects. specified column subject IDs first column. default 1.

title: Function to import epidemiology-related data from different sources into R — readepi
text: list 2 data frames (data metadata) reading REDCap. data frame otherwise.

title: Function to import epidemiology-related data from different sources into R — readepi
code: data = readepi(credentials.file=system.file("extdata", "test.ini", package = "readepi"), project.id="Pats__Covid_19_Cohort_1_Screening") #> Starting to read 280 records  at 2023-01-16 15:40:18. #>  #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> cols( #>   .default = col_double(), #>   day_1_q_ran_id = col_character(), #>   redcap_event_name = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_1a = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_1b = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_1c = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_1 = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_2 = col_datetime(format = ""), #>   day_1_q_4 = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_6c = col_character(), #>   day_1_oth_spc_vac = col_logical(), #>   day_1_q_9e = col_date(format = ""), #>   day_1_9hi = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_9f_2 = col_date(format = ""), #>   day_1_q_11 = col_time(format = ""), #>   day_1_q_14 = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_16 = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_16a = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_16d = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_17 = col_character(), #>   day_1_q_17a = col_character() #>   # ... with 509 more columns #> ) #> ℹ Use `spec()` for the full column specifications.
